language.entry: Valid below %d%% HP
{colour_start|mark}Marked{colour_end} Consume {colour_start|mark}Mark{colour_end}
Cure {colour_start|bleed}Bleed{colour_end}
Wheeling Disengage
Tight passages... no escape!
The horse senses danger, it knows our doom!
Predators surround us... nowhere to run!
I can't control it, the instinct to flee is too great!
My skull knows what you did.
You mean to take my mount? I'll take your life!
Death couldn't separate us. Neither will you.
You conspire to break our bond!
You led us into this trap, filth!
Bloody spears, broken bones. Mine or theirs. No difference.
Clarity amidst a haze of red...
Shatter my legs, pierce my lungs!
I am but rusted mail. Come, scrub me clean.
I am dirt under your feet. Come, trample me!
Amateurs, you ride out of formation.
Worthless, not fit to shovel the stables.
I ride forth, and you cower behind me like dogs!
Selfish. Pitiful. You endanger us all.
Look what you've done! Look what you let happen!
I alone know the path.
YOU will protect ME.
I carry two souls and you one. You go first.
Everything I do is for your benefit.
My place is at the front of the charge. Your place is behind me.
...It grows quiet...
I ask for guidance, only to be met with silence...
Just whispers; only whispers.
I've disappointed it, and now it deserts me...
Please...just a word...speak to me...
Sungrass below clear skies...
<Whinnies>
<Stamps foot> WHERE IS MY FEED BAG?
<Runs in circles>
Please, not the whip again...
Heads high, banners higher!
Rally! Rally, damn you!
Lead from the front, and follow me to victory!
Follow me. In my absence, follow my example.
Our souls are one. We will break them!
Two souls. One purpose.
Shatter their ranks! Break their shields! Leave nothing but dust!
Watch their ranks crumble under our winnowing onslaught!
I could fight for days.
A tide of steel against a wall of sand.
By the skull's power, I am renewed!
Nothing can stop me!
Formation! Wash over them like steel rain!
By the stars in the sky, we WILL see green fields again.
There can be no peace without war. Pick up your weapon.
Mercy is for nurses and mothers. Wash them from your boots.
The unit, as the herd, ride and run and fight and die together.
They are nothing to us. Together, we will rinse their guts from our spears.
I've my second wind, and with it, their end.
My charge is a wellspring of unlimited vigor. I will drown you in it.
Sulfur and blood, sulfur and blood, sulfur and...
<Nervous breathing>
I'm not yet ready to meet my end.
I see your nervous glances. You think me unhinged?
I speak to my skull, and it speaks back. It tells me not to trust you.
You're like all the rest. You see madness instead of power.
<Spits blood> More.
Again! Lash me again!
The bite of the crop, the sting of the spurs! Exquisite!
The only songs they'll sing of you will be the ones that make me look better.
You'll have plenty of time to think of your mistakes. Alone.
I would not mourn you.
If we die, it'll be your fault.
Even my horse finds you distasteful.
My horse doesn't like you. I don't like you.
Whispers, nothing left but whispers...
Louder... please, speak louder!
The skull shimmers no longer. I have failed.
Drat! I seem to have misplaced my saddle.
Communing with my dead horse through its skull. Absurd.
Gaining power through bones? What sort of madman would do such a thing?
The battle has turned!
Where is the banner? Where is our guidance?
I-I'll cover the flanks!
Eyes gleam in every shadow.
This thing pales in comparison to the treachery you plot. Move aside.
And let you stab me in the back? Forward with you!
RIDE TO RUIN!
No death could be more deserved.
A mighty death awaits!
<Trots forward>
Aah... soft grass beneath my hooves...
I am dead. What do I have to fear?
Is that salt?
Poor Freckles. Thought of water and died.
Was that a bee?!
A horseman without his horse is half a man.
Courage brought him back, perhaps it will do so once more.
Lost in confusion, I can step only forward.
The battle shifts, but I cannot keep up!
A mask of steel to hide my misery.
What twisted, nightmare spawned loneliness!
Stand aside. We'll take it from here.
I'm half worthless where you are and could still do your job better. Watch!
I could kill this thing with one move. In fact, I think I will.
Trifling things. You can win without me, I'm sure.
Now, a demonstration of my superior tactical prowess.
You distract them. I'll get a head start on our retreat.
I-I don't know what to do!
P-perhaps they are friendly?
This was just a misunderstanding, we can make friends, I'm sure.
I must not distract myself when the true threat remains unseen.
The free-spirited stallion does as he wishes.
I smell deceit on the wind.
Pitiful. I'll not waste the effort.
No, I think I'll follow my own orders this time.
And risk you getting me killed? Feh!
Shh -- I can't hear it!
I mustn't startle it again.
<Lethargic moaning>
<Stamps in place>
<Whinnies>
Aah... look how it glitters...
I am my own man!
The startled horse is as unpredictable as the wind.
I trust only my mount!
Ha-ha, nicely struck. Now me.
Allow me to show you what real pain feels like.
It takes a certain madness to intervene on another's behalf.
I can do that better. Watch.
Observe prowess.
Nothing you do could hope to achieve as much as this.
We need only each other.
I deserve this, I have earned it!
This is why they tell stories about me.
Wait! It says I must...
I must demonstrate my will, to coax it from hiding.
Attack? Heal? Augh, to hell with it!
<Angry snort>
I... must... retain... control!!
I am the rider! You are the mount!
We must keep moving. Outrun them, outpace them.
My legs crumple, my lungs burn. But I must run faster still.
It is foolish to camp here. We are exposed.
The campfire will give us away. Douse it, lest we be set upon.
I will be here. Away from the rest of you.
Cease your constant jangling, lest we be ambushed in the night.
My wounds do not need tending.
The rush of burning air from my lungs... exhilarating.
I wonder if it feels pain as I do. Ow. Yes, it does.
Your stories bore me.
You talk too much.
Are you certain you locked the doors? I will check, just in case.
The hardest worker deserves the highest share.
Nobody tells stories about heroes at camp. We should be out killing.
My bedroll is infested with horselice. I'll be using yours.
... Please... say something...
Without it's guidance, how will we survive?
I have angered it, but I do not know why...
<Gazes into the fire, transfixed.>
Spare any oats?
Oh, to lay upon a bed of straw.
I will draw their fire!
They can sense its power. They come!
Come, take it. If you can.
This lonely misery must end.
An act of bravery to coax out the burning beast!
<Stomps and snorts.>
<Angry braying>
They smell blood. Suffocate them with it.
My armor will stop any blow. Allow me to demonstrate.
A gift of blood, to ignite its rage.
Is this what you want? Is my blood what you're after, damned spectre?!
It's not my body. Why would I preserve it?
This rock looks delicious.
No! Fleeing will only silence it for good!
You'd cut me down to secure your own safety.
The spectre comes alive in battle. We stay.
This is what it wants, damn you.
We've not yet begun to fight.
More.
Run? Where?
I'm quite happy where I am, thank you.
Protect the skull!
No! You'll not take it!
You let that happen!
You can't kill me if I'm already dead! Aha!
It'd be a boring tale if I remain unbloodied.
They are weak. I am strong. Let's even this out.
My iron hide is unbreakable.
I don't even feel it!
<Trips>
I've not yet spit enough blood.
Blasted helmet blocks my vision.
My weapon slipped. Sweat. That's all.
Who nudged me?
Convenient.
Another chance to bleed.
Ah, more opportunities to test my mettle.
No, with your hooves, your hooves!
<Disapproving snort>
How dare you steal my moment of glory.
Stand aside, the final blow belongs to me.
We stand on the precipice, and this is your best?
May the next life grant me more competent allies.
How do you manage, with such awkward hands?
To think, they managed it without hooves.
Well. Guess we die now.
One foot into the grave.
Waiting until after it kills me to slay it?
Another war. Another survivor.
One foot into the grave, and you miss?
Pinning our hopes on a nearsighted miscreant.
No, keep missing. It will make me look better.
I'll make sure you're written as the comic relief.
<Disapproving snort>
Thumbs only get in the way.
Another grim war story in the making.
Good, keep distracting them while I work this door open.
You're only making it look good.
Fighting over my skull already?
That looked painful. A shame.
A frightening hit. Try it on me next time.
Disappointing.
You saw it coming. You did nothing.
Step, step, step, trot, trot, trot.
You lack my nimble grace.
Our luck is running out.
I will not fumble for long. Ready your legs.
Deception.
What a cruel thing, hope.
Yes, good! Dance about on your own four legs!
Aah, sorry. I bumped you.
It would kill us. Choose another.
I'll not die to this foolishness, but you might.
My position is secured.
I'll not allow these guttersnipes to sneak up on me.
They can see me just fine from here.
I am the iron wall they will break upon.
Know your place. In my shadow.
I don't want to move. So I won't.
A horse moves when it wants.
Twelve hundred pounds of muscle and you think you can nudge me aside?
Laced with poison, surely.
From that gap-toothed Caretaker? I think not.
Heroes do not need band-aids.
I will fight through it.
I can't risk startling it further.
We've put our faith in trinkets. Now look where we are.
<Chews>
How could I use this with such clumsy hands?
I trust only the skull.
Begone with your muttering.
Repair the skull first.
I am no damsel.
They've not yet broken upon me.
Humph. Give them a sporting chance.
Its power is far greater than yours.
It is quiet. I mustn't taint it with further magic.
Cease your chanting! I can't hear the skull!
<Startled snort>
I need only the fresh air.
If it's not fresh grain, I don't want it.
I am dubious.
A boon, or a hex? I'd risk neither.
Unfamiliar. Pass.
This is no ensemble tale.
Coattail passengers, clawing their way to relevance.
A giant does not need allies to stand tall.
The spirit is shattered, and cannot be repaired...
You cannot help return its voice to me.
If you cannot force it to speak, then you are of no use.
Trust naught but your own four hooves.
Feeble aid to an incorporeal host.
<Disapproving snort>
It approves of you.
That move earlier. I would like to see it again.
I've not seen a person fight like that for a long while.
Hold still. This will not sting if you do not fidget.
Blood can be replenished and poison purged.
There. Favour your other leg until it can be healed.
The things down here are aimless, without direction. We will overcome.
The cruelty of man is much greater than skeletons and filthy pigs.
Pray to your gods. Beg for guidance. It will come, if you listen.
What if I need these supplies for later?
It will do us no good.
Firelight grows dim. There is no escape.
What if I need these supplies for later?
It whispers of conspiracy.
They do not need my aid. They would misuse it.
This pain is nothing.
I am fine.
Dented armor is a sign of use. A sign of pride.
I help those who deserve it.
A wasted effort.
Give of myself? To THEM?
I ride alone.
No. No more stories tonight.
It would make for a poor story.
Without its aid, I cannot help anyone...
I have no guidance, so I can provide none.
Without the skull, I am powerless...
<Chews>
How does this even work?
No. This is a perversion of my power.
Don't touch me.
Keep your fingers to yourself, knave.
I see you eyeing the skull. Look elsewhere.
This? War scar in the making.
It's just a flesh wound.
A few dents in the plate build character.
Whatever you think you're doing, don't.
I'm happier when you don't get involved.
Don't get attached.
There can be no rest for the damned...
Hush. You're scaring the horse.
I can't hear it...
Got any oats?
<Inquisitive head tilt>
Ugh. Rotten.
Check the seals on the tin. I don't trust that Caretaker.
Not hungry.
Hunger in the belly. Hunger on the battlefield.
Busy. I'll eat later.
Oh, I've had plenty enough... <hic>
<Gnaws on tin can>
Horses don't eat meat.
No offense, but I can't have you in top shape if you're planning on taking my skull.
It's your fault it's not talking!
Beware! The skull crackles with energy!
No. Swing like this.
Stand aside or be trampled!
<Kicks>
Together we cannot be stopped!
Wheel about for another!
A clean split!
Right down the middle.
Steel heart, steel hand.
Dismounted!
An unstoppable force!
I am not yet ready to join it.
They'll not claim either of our skulls
It tells me to fight on, and so I go.
We'll ride together in green fields under warm skies. It is time.
The skull whispers ever louder...
Miracle Pelvis
Withered Apple
Haunted Cubes
Conter's Strike
Skull of Knowledge
Scorched Saddle
War Commendation
Bloody Banner
"Glory. Above all else."
A Dark Rider
... While the man wears riding leathers and wields a long spear, none have seen any sign of his horse, save for the curiously etched skull he clutches at all times.
A Timely Rescue
... The surviors were luckily rescued by an armored rider carrying a gleaming banner astride a horse wreathed in flame. Any witnesses to this terrible act...
Cataphract
Thrust
Warmth
Banner of the East
Wheeling Disengage
Winnowing Volley
Pin Down
Onslaught
Move
Thrust
Warmth
Banner of the East
Wheeling Disengage
Winnowing Volley
Pin Down
Onslaught
NIGHTMARE
MEND BANNER
POLISH ARMOR
WAR STORIES
Your dreams will be restless, but uninterrupted.
Sleep tight...
We must take pride in our symbols and strive to care for them as we do ourselves.
Wars are won and lost on the strength of symbols like this.
Even a miserable place like this is no excuse for shoddy equipment.
Resplendent.
... Many were cut down in that final, glorious charge. Good friends, lost...
... An uphill charge, banner high, hooves soaked in mud, blood, and bone...
... I alone survived the battle. A hundred strong, reduced to one. Again.
Blunted Spear and Skull Chip
Sharpened Spear and Skull Fragment
Steel Kontos and Skull Section
Winged Kontos and Flawless Skull
"Razorwind & Kargadaan"
Spear and Bone Fragment
Battleworn Splint
Dented Splint Mail
Reinforced Splint Mail
Steel Splint Mail
"The Eastern Herald"
Splint Mail
I'll take a barn over that... place.
I do not belong here.
Pass.
The body is a temple. Show me to a stone one.

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.

Tight passages... no escape!
The horse senses danger, it knows our doom!

Clarity amidst a haze of red...
Shatter my legs, pierce my lungs!
I am but rusted mail. Come, scrub me clean.

Amateurs, you ride out of formation.
Worthless, not fit to shovel the stables.
I ride forth, and you cower behind me like dogs!
Selfish. Pitiful. You endanger us all.
Look what you've done! Look what you let happen!
I alone know the path.
YOU will protect ME.

Just whispers; only whispers.
I've disappointed it, and now it deserts me...
Please...just a word...speak to me...
Sungrass below clear skies...

Please, not the whip again...
Heads high, banners higher!
Rally! Rally, damn you!
Lead from the front, and follow me to victory!
Follow me. In my absence, follow my example.
Our souls are one. We will break them!
Two souls. One purpose.
Shatter their ranks! Break their shields! Leave nothing but dust!
Watch their ranks crumble under our winnowing onslaught!
I could fight for days.
A tide of steel against a wall of sand.
By the skull's power, I am renewed!
Nothing can stop me!
Formation! Wash over them like steel rain!
By the stars in the sky, we WILL see green fields again.
There can be no peace without war. Pick up your weapon.
Mercy is for nurses and mothers. Wash them from your boots.
The unit, as the herd, ride and run and fight and die together.
They are nothing to us. Together, we will rinse their guts from our spears.
I've my second wind, and with it, their end.
My charge is a wellspring of unlimited vigor. I will drown you in it.
Sulfur and blood, sulfur and blood, sulfur and...
<Nervous breathing>
I'm not yet ready to meet my end.
I see your nervous glances. You think me unhinged?
I speak to my skull, and it speaks back. It tells me not to trust you.
You're like all the rest. You see madness instead of power.
<Spits blood> More.
Again! Lash me again!
The bite of the crop, the sting of the spurs! Exquisite!
The only songs they'll sing of you will be the ones that make me look better.
You'll have plenty of time to think of your mistakes. Alone.
I would not mourn you.
If we die, it'll be your fault.
Even my horse finds you distasteful.
My horse doesn't like you. I don't like you.

Louder... please, speak louder!
The skull shimmers no longer. I have failed.
Drat! I seem to have misplaced my saddle.

I-I'll cover the flanks!
Eyes gleam in every shadow.

RIDE TO RUIN!
No death could be more deserved.
A mighty death awaits!
<Trots forward>
Aah... soft grass beneath my hooves...
I am dead. What do I have to fear?
Is that salt?
Poor Freckles. Thought of water and died.
Was that a bee?!
A horseman without his horse is half a man.
Courage brought him back, perhaps it will do so once more.
Lost in confusion, I can step only forward.
The battle shifts, but I cannot keep up!
A mask of steel to hide my misery.
What twisted, nightmare spawned loneliness!
Stand aside. We'll take it from here.
I'm half worthless where you are and could still do your job better. Watch!
I could kill this thing with one move. In fact, I think I will.
Trifling things. You can win without me, I'm sure.
Now, a demonstration of my superior tactical prowess.
You distract them. I'll get a head start on our retreat.

Your stories bore me.
You talk too much.

The hardest worker deserves the highest share.
Nobody tells stories about heroes at camp. We should be out killing.

Splint Mail

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.

Wheeling Disengage
Tight passages... no escape!
The horse senses danger, it knows our doom!
Predators surround us... nowhere to run!
I can't control it, the instinct to flee is too great!
My skull knows what you did.
You mean to take my mount? I'll take your life!
Death couldn't separate us. Neither will you.
You conspire to break our bond!
You led us into this trap, filth!
Bloody spears, broken bones. Mine or theirs. No difference.
Clarity amidst a haze of red...
Shatter my legs, pierce my lungs!
I am but rusted mail. Come, scrub me clean.
I am dirt under your feet. Come, trample me!
Amateurs, you ride out of formation.
Worthless, not fit to shovel the stables.
I ride forth, and you cower behind me like dogs!
Selfish. Pitiful. You endanger us all.
Look what you've done! Look what you let happen!
I alone know the path.
YOU will protect ME.
I carry two souls and you one. You go first.
Everything I do is for your benefit.
My place is at the front of the charge. Your place is behind me.
...It grows quiet...
I ask for guidance, only to be met with silence...
Just whispers; only whispers.
I've disappointed it, and now it deserts me...
Please...just a word...speak to me...
Sungrass below clear skies...
<Whinnies>
<Stamps foot> WHERE IS MY FEED BAG?
<Runs in circles>
Please, not the whip again...
Heads high, banners higher!
Rally! Rally, damn you!
Lead from the front, and follow me to victory!
Follow me. In my absence, follow my example.
Our souls are one. We will break them!
Two souls. One purpose.
Shatter their ranks! Break their shields! Leave nothing but dust!
Watch their ranks crumble under our winnowing onslaught!
I could fight for days.
A tide of steel against a wall of sand.
By the skull's power, I am renewed!
Nothing can stop me!
Formation! Wash over them like steel rain!
By the stars in the sky, we WILL see green fields again.
There can be no peace without war. Pick up your weapon.
Mercy is for nurses and mothers. Wash them from your boots.
The unit, as the herd, ride and run and fight and die together.
They are nothing to us. Together, we will rinse their guts from our spears.
I've my second wind, and with it, their end.
My charge is a wellspring of unlimited vigor. I will drown you in it.
Sulfur and blood, sulfur and blood, sulfur and...
<Nervous breathing>
I'm not yet ready to meet my end.
I see your nervous glances. You think me unhinged?
I speak to my skull, and it speaks back. It tells me not to trust you.
You're like all the rest. You see madness instead of power.
<Spits blood> More.
Again! Lash me again!
The bite of the crop, the sting of the spurs! Exquisite!
The only songs they'll sing of you will be the ones that make me look better.
You'll have plenty of time to think of your mistakes. Alone.
I would not mourn you.
If we die, it'll be your fault.
Even my horse finds you distasteful.
My horse doesn't like you. I don't like you.
Whispers, nothing left but whispers...
Louder... please, speak louder!
The skull shimmers no longer. I have failed.
Drat! I seem to have misplaced my saddle.
Communing with my dead horse through its skull. Absurd.
Gaining power through bones? What sort of madman would do such a thing?
The battle has turned!
Where is the banner? Where is our guidance?
I-I'll cover the flanks!
Eyes gleam in every shadow.
This thing pales in comparison to the treachery you plot. Move aside.
And let you stab me in the back? Forward with you!
RIDE TO RUIN!
No death could be more deserved.
A mighty death awaits!
<Trots forward>
Aah... soft grass beneath my hooves...
I am dead. What do I have to fear?
Is that salt?
Poor Freckles. Thought of water and died.
Was that a bee?!
A horseman without his horse is half a man.
Courage brought him back, perhaps it will do so once more.
Lost in confusion, I can step only forward.
The battle shifts, but I cannot keep up!
A mask of steel to hide my misery.
What twisted, nightmare spawned loneliness!
Stand aside. We'll take it from here.
I'm half worthless where you are and could still do your job better. Watch!
I could kill this thing with one move. In fact, I think I will.
Trifling things. You can win without me, I'm sure.
Now, a demonstration of my superior tactical prowess.
You distract them. I'll get a head start on our retreat.
I-I don't know what to do!
P-perhaps they are friendly?
This was just a misunderstanding, we can make friends, I'm sure.
I must not distract myself when the true threat remains unseen.
The free-spirited stallion does as he wishes.
I smell deceit on the wind.
Pitiful. I'll not waste the effort.
No, I think I'll follow my own orders this time.
And risk you getting me killed? Feh!
Shh -- I can't hear it!
I mustn't startle it again.
<Lethargic moaning>
<Stamps in place>
<Whinnies>
Aah... look how it glitters...
I am my own man!
The startled horse is as unpredictable as the wind.
I trust only my mount!
Ha-ha, nicely struck. Now me.
Allow me to show you what real pain feels like.
It takes a certain madness to intervene on another's behalf.
I can do that better. Watch.
Observe prowess.
Nothing you do could hope to achieve as much as this.
We need only each other.
I deserve this, I have earned it!
This is why they tell stories about me.
Wait! It says I must...
I must demonstrate my will, to coax it from hiding.
Attack? Heal? Augh, to hell with it!
<Angry snort>
I... must... retain... control!!
I am the rider! You are the mount!
We must keep moving. Outrun them, outpace them.
My legs crumple, my lungs burn. But I must run faster still.
It is foolish to camp here. We are exposed.
The campfire will give us away. Douse it, lest we be set upon.
I will be here. Away from the rest of you.
Cease your constant jangling, lest we be ambushed in the night.
My wounds do not need tending.
The rush of burning air from my lungs... exhilarating.
I wonder if it feels pain as I do. Ow. Yes, it does.
Your stories bore me.
You talk too much.
Are you certain you locked the doors? I will check, just in case.
The hardest worker deserves the highest share.
Nobody tells stories about heroes at camp. We should be out killing.
My bedroll is infested with horselice. I'll be using yours.
... Please... say something...
Without it's guidance, how will we survive?
I have angered it, but I do not know why...
<Gazes into the fire, transfixed.>
Spare any oats?
Oh, to lay upon a bed of straw.
I will draw their fire!
They can sense its power. They come!
Come, take it. If you can.
This lonely misery must end.
An act of bravery to coax out the burning beast!
<Stomps and snorts.>
<Angry braying>
They smell blood. Suffocate them with it.
My armor will stop any blow. Allow me to demonstrate.
A gift of blood, to ignite its rage.
Is this what you want? Is my blood what you're after, damned spectre?!
It's not my body. Why would I preserve it?
This rock looks delicious.
No! Fleeing will only silence it for good!
You'd cut me down to secure your own safety.
The spectre comes alive in battle. We stay.
This is what it wants, damn you.
We've not yet begun to fight.
More.
Run? Where?
I'm quite happy where I am, thank you.
Protect the skull!
No! You'll not take it!
You let that happen!
You can't kill me if I'm already dead! Aha!
It'd be a boring tale if I remain unbloodied.
They are weak. I am strong. Let's even this out.
My iron hide is unbreakable.
I don't even feel it!
<Trips>
I've not yet spit enough blood.
Blasted helmet blocks my vision.
My weapon slipped. Sweat. That's all.
Who nudged me?
Convenient.
Another chance to bleed.
Ah, more opportunities to test my mettle.
No, with your hooves, your hooves!
<Disapproving snort>
How dare you steal my moment of glory.
Stand aside, the final blow belongs to me.
We stand on the precipice, and this is your best?
May the next life grant me more competent allies.
How do you manage, with such awkward hands?
To think, they managed it without hooves.
Well. Guess we die now.
One foot into the grave.
Waiting until after it kills me to slay it?
Another war. Another survivor.
One foot into the grave, and you miss?
Pinning our hopes on a nearsighted miscreant.
No, keep missing. It will make me look better.
I'll make sure you're written as the comic relief.
<Disapproving snort>
Thumbs only get in the way.
Another grim war story in the making.
Good, keep distracting them while I work this door open.
You're only making it look good.
Fighting over my skull already?
That looked painful. A shame.
A frightening hit. Try it on me next time.
Disappointing.
You saw it coming. You did nothing.
Step, step, step, trot, trot, trot.
You lack my nimble grace.
Our luck is running out.
I will not fumble for long. Ready your legs.
Deception.
What a cruel thing, hope.
Yes, good! Dance about on your own four legs!
Aah, sorry. I bumped you.
It would kill us. Choose another.
I'll not die to this foolishness, but you might.
My position is secured.
I'll not allow these guttersnipes to sneak up on me.
They can see me just fine from here.
I am the iron wall they will break upon.
Know your place. In my shadow.
I don't want to move. So I won't.
A horse moves when it wants.
Twelve hundred pounds of muscle and you think you can nudge me aside?
Laced with poison, surely.
From that gap-toothed Caretaker? I think not.
Heroes do not need band-aids.
I will fight through it.
I can't risk startling it further.
We've put our faith in trinkets. Now look where we are.
<Chews>
How could I use this with such clumsy hands?
I trust only the skull.
Begone with your muttering.
Repair the skull first.
I am no damsel.
They've not yet broken upon me.
Humph. Give them a sporting chance.
Its power is far greater than yours.
It is quiet. I mustn't taint it with further magic.
Cease your chanting! I can't hear the skull!
<Startled snort>
I need only the fresh air.
If it's not fresh grain, I don't want it.
I am dubious.
A boon, or a hex? I'd risk neither.
Unfamiliar. Pass.
This is no ensemble tale.
Coattail passengers, clawing their way to relevance.
A giant does not need allies to stand tall.
The spirit is shattered, and cannot be repaired...
You cannot help return its voice to me.
If you cannot force it to speak, then you are of no use.
Trust naught but your own four hooves.
Feeble aid to an incorporeal host.
<Disapproving snort>
It approves of you.
That move earlier. I would like to see it again.
I've not seen a person fight like that for a long while.
Hold still. This will not sting if you do not fidget.
Blood can be replenished and poison purged.
There. Favour your other leg until it can be healed.
The things down here are aimless, without direction. We will overcome.
The cruelty of man is much greater than skeletons and filthy pigs.

What if I need these supplies for later?
It will do us no good.
Firelight grows dim. There is no escape.
What if I need these supplies for later?
It whispers of conspiracy.
They do not need my aid. They would misuse it.
This pain is nothing.
I am fine.
Dented armor is a sign of use. A sign of pride.
I help those who deserve it.
A wasted effort.
Give of myself? To THEM?
I ride alone.
No. No more stories tonight.
It would make for a poor story.
Without its aid, I cannot help anyone...
I have no guidance, so I can provide none.
Without the skull, I am powerless...
<Chews>

No. This is a perversion of my power.
Don't touch me.
Keep your fingers to yourself, knave.
I see you eyeing the skull. Look elsewhere.

It's just a flesh wound.
A few dents in the plate build character.
Whatever you think you're doing, don't.
I'm happier when you don't get involved.
Don't get attached.
There can be no rest for the damned...
Hush. You're scaring the horse.
I can't hear it...
Got any oats?
<Inquisitive head tilt>
Ugh. Rotten.
Check the seals on the tin. I don't trust that Caretaker.
Not hungry.

Busy. I'll eat later.
Oh, I've had plenty enough... <hic>
<Gnaws on tin can>

No offense, but I can't have you in top shape if you're planning on taking my skull.
It's your fault it's not talking!
Beware! The skull crackles with energy!
No. Swing like this.
Stand aside or be trampled!

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.

Adept at leading from the front and supporting from the rear, the Cataphract skirts the edges of the battlefield, quickly alternating between breaking enemy lines and supporting his allies at the front. He is weakest in the middle ranks, and being forced out of position reduces his effectiveness severely.

Weilding a trusty spear and carrying the enscorceled skull of a long-dead horse, the Cataphract makes good use of his summoned mount to dart around the battlefield and wind up for powerful charge attacks. Should he find himself on the front line, hefty scale mail ensures only the most brutal attacks harm him, or his ghostly steed.

The Cataphract is a veteran of many wars, and the stories he tells entertain his party, but leaves him sullen with sour memories. He brings the skills learned in battle to the campfire, tending wounds and maintaining equipment. His mysterious mount feeds off dreams, and haunts the party's sleep while ensuring they remain uninterrupted.
